DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Outcome Radiation Therapy CAHPS Cancer Care Survey Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A standardized instrument designed to assess the experiences of adult patients with cancer treatment provided in outpatient and inpatient settings. The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Outcome Radiation Therapy CAHPS Cancer Care Survey
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A standardized instrument designed to assess the experiences of adult patients with cancer treatment provided in outpatient and inpatient settings. The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy CAHPS Cancer Care Survey
Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A standardized instrument designed to assess the experiences of adult patients with cancer treatment provided in outpatient and inpatient settings. The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

A standardized instrument designed to assess the experiences of adult patients with cancer treatment provided in outpatient and inpatient settings. The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
